intro: Phyllanthus polygonoides, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters, featuring woody stems and opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes, including treating skin conditions and as a tonic.
